Feature name: Role-based access control
One Line Release Note Description: Further polishing of the alpha API including a default set of cluster roles.

Feature name: Dramatically Simplify Kubernetes Cluster Creation
One Line Release Note Description: Use kubeadm to make it easy to get a cluster running.

Feature name: Simplify HA Setup for Master
One Line Release Note Description: Added ability to create/remove clusters w/highly available (replicaed) masters on GCE using kube-up/kube-down scripts.

Feature name: Federated Daemonset
One Line Release Note Description: Alpha level support for Daemonsets in federation.

Feature name: Federated Deployments
One Line Release Note Description: Alpha level support for Deployments in federation.

Feature name: Federation: Support generalized deletions, including cascading and ...
One Line Release Note Description: Cluster federation: Added support for DeleteOptions.OrphanDependents for federation resources.

Feature name: It should be fast and painless to deploy a Federation of Kubernetes
One Line Release Note Description: Introducing `kubefed`, a new command line tool to simplify federation control plane deployment and cluster registration/deregistration experience.

Feature name: Enable userns support for containers launched by kubelet
One Line Release Note Description: Added ability to preserve access to host userns when userns remapping is enabled in container runtime

Feature name: Container Runtime Interface (CRI)
One Line Release Note Description: Introducing the v1alpha1 CRI API to allow pluggable container runtimes; an experimental docker-CRI integration is ready for testing and feedback.

Feature name: Add support for pod and qos level cgroups
One Line Release Note Description: Kubelet launches container in a per pod cgroup hiearchy based on quality of service tier

Feature name: Accounting and feasibility for opaque integer resources in the API
One Line Release Note Description: Added support for accounting opaque integer resources.

Feature name: Support Windows Server Containers for K8s
One Line Release Note Description: Added support for Windows Server 2016 nodes and scheduling Windows Server Containers

Feature name: Allow deployments to correctly indicate they are failing to deploy
One Line Release Note Description: Deployments that cannot make progress in rolling out the newest version will now indicate via the API they are blocked

Feature name: StatefulSets to Beta
One Line Release Note Description: StatefulSets allow workloads that require persistent identity or per-instance storage to be created and managed on Kubernetes.

Feature name: Make StatefulSets safe during cluster failure
One Line Release Note Description: In order to preserve safety guarantees the cluster no longer force deletes pods on un-responsive nodes and users are now warned if they try to force delete pods via the CLI.

Feature name: Authenticated/Authorized access to kubelet API
One Line Release Note Description: Added ability to authenticate/authorize access to the Kubelet API

Feature name: Federated ConfigMap
One Line Release Note Description: Support for config maps in federation.

Feature name: GCP Cloud Provider: Source IP preservation for Virtual IPs
One Line Release Note Description: Opt in source ip preservation for Services with Type NodePort or LoadBalancer

Feature name: Improve responsiveness of kubelet eviction module
One Line Release Note Description: Kubelet integrates with memcg notification API to detect when a hard eviction threshold is crossed

Feature name: Node Conformance Test
One Line Release Note Description: Introducing the beta version containerized node conformance test gcr.io/google_containers/node-test:0.2 for users to verify node setup.

Feature name: PodDisruptionBudget and /eviction subresource
One Line Release Note Description: Moving PodDisruptionBudget to Beta + Machine drain task doc

Feature name: Communicate replica set and deployment status via conditions
One Line Release Note Description: When replica sets cannot create pods, they will now report detail via the API about the underlying reason

Feature name: Support deleting previous objects in `kubectl apply`
One Line Release Note Description: `kubectl apply` is now able to delete resources you no longer need with --prune

Feature name: Show roles in kubectl
One Line Release Note Description: Roles should appear in kubectl get nodes

Feature name: Support services that reference an external service
One Line Release Note Description: Services can reference another service by DNS name, rather than being hosted in pods.

Feature name: Dashboard UI: show all user facing resources
One Line Release Note Description: Dashboard UI now shows all user facing objects and their resource usage.

Feature name: OpenAPI/Swagger 2.0 support
One Line Release Note Description: OpenAPI spec is now generated on API_SERVER/swagger.json
